file_content.text: The captives are free and clear. I'm watching for more.
Just give the captives the opportunity to run. I'll take it from there.
What are you doing here? I didn't think anyone could escape from the minders.
Wait... you're armed. You're not a Killik prisoner at all.
The Killiks have prisoners?
Should I be?
That's what I've been telling people, but no one listens.
Who are you?
I'm Elz. House Organa sent me out here when House Syrush fell to the Killiks.
A year ago, these things swarmed all over, and we presumed all captives were dead.
But I found they've still got human prisoners.
What are you doing this close to man-eating bugs?
How have you survived here?
Watching and waiting. House Syrush has been gone a year, but the Killiks who took over their estate are busy, busy.
You can't get too close, but you can tell who's got four limbs and who's got six.
That's how I know the Killiks still have human captives.
I can put an end to that right now.
That needs to be stopped.
We'll do it together. You get them free. I'll get them home.
How do you know?
I've been out here for a year, hiding my tracks, my smell, burying spoor, burying Killik bodies. I know Killiks.
But there aren't spies or soldiers to spare if you don't have a last name of Ulgo or Thul.
I'm sure the Organas can spare a few people to rescue the prisoners.
The Organas can help.
House Organa assumes they're dead. My reports get buried under a mountain of Thul and Ulgo data.
Oh, it's Crazy Elz still holding out hope, they say.
If I don't keep hope alive, where does it put the prisoners? They need to believe, and they need a way out.
Show me where the prisoners are, and we'll get them free.
We'll do it together, then.
I'm not much good in a fight, but I can handle getting a shocked prisoner home.
You take out the Killik guards at the estate and send the prisoners running to me. I'll mask their smell and get them to the Republic outpost.
Captain Quarn takes care of former prisoners there. Make sure they all make it to him. Good luck.
I'd need to be paid.
That can be handled. Now, let's coordinate this--you be the muscle and I'll be the getaway.
I thought Jedi were supposed to--never mind. Captain Quarn at the Republic outpost can take care of that.
Captain Quarn at the Republic outpost handles that.
You just have to remove the Killiks at the estates and get the captives clear. I'll mask their scent and get them to the outpost.
Check in with Captain Quarn to make sure they all made it, and you'll have your reward.
There's no way we can escort someone through an alerted hive of Killiks.
Can't do it. [Refuse quest]
If you don't think so, get out of my hiding spot.
They can smell you. Stay away.
